document_data.name: Tristopher Chettlebell
document_data.mainbody:
'''Tristopher Chettlebell''' was a historian and a scholar of [[Neverwinter]] who was alive during the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|Have I told you I'm a genius?|Tristopher, upon greeting someone for the first time}}
document_data.Personality: Tristopher was somewhat haughty, believing himself to be of exceptional intelligence.
document_data.Relationships: He had a number of wealthy patrons, including [[Zami Monini]], of the [[Blacklake District|Blacklake]] Moninis,
document_data.Possessed: Tristopher owned a copy of ''[[The Annals of Neverdeath]]'', a book that offered significant information in his research about the city's history.
document_data.History:
As a sage, Tristopher tried to record the history of Neverwinter. ''Circa'' the {{yearlinkName|1479}}, he became obsessed with reconstructing the story of the [[dracolich]] [[Azharzel]] buried somewhere in [[Neverdeath Graveyard]], recruiting the [[Hero of Sleeping Dragon Bridge]] to help his research.

Soon after, Trisopher and his patron Zami Monini were venturing into [[Craftsman's Rest]] when they were assaulted by [[Cult of the Dragon|dragon cultists]]. While Tristopher escaped to safety, Lady Monini was not so fortunate and needed to be rescued by the adventurer. The information that Tristopher uncovered proved very useful to the [[Harper]] agent [[Windle]], in her group's efforts to thwart the activities of the cult and stop the machinations of the malevolent [[Valindra Shadowmantle]].
